Using an HTML page evaluator, I ran an accessibility check on the Gucci website (https://www.gucci.com/). The evaluator returned the following results in an HTML table:
| Error Type | Number of Occurrences |
|------------|----------------------|
| Missing alt attribute on image | 8 |
| Empty link text | 4 |
| Missing form label | 2 |
| Contrast ratio below 4.5:1 | 6 |
| Empty button link text | 1 |
Based on the evaluation, what specific changes can be made to improve the accessibility of the website?

To improve the accessibility of the Gucci website based on the evaluation results, the following specific changes can be made: 1. **Missing Alt Attribute on Images (8 occurrences):** - Ensure all images have descriptive `alt` attributes. This helps screen readers convey the content and purpose of images to users with visual impairments. - Example: `` 2. **Empty Link Text (4 occurrences):** - Provide clear and descriptive text for all links. Avoid using generic terms like "click here." - Example: Instead of ``, use `View the Gucci handbag collection` 3. **Missing Form Label (2 occurrences):** - Ensure that all form fields have associated labels using the `
